title: Write a Real-World Inequality
prompt:
The population of Sherwood is 32,404. The population, P, of Baker is at least half
the population of Sherwood. Which inequality represents the population of Baker?
feedback:
<math>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Half of 32,404 is 16,202</mtext><mtext>. So, the population of Baker is at least 16,202</mtext><mtext>.</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>"At least" uses the symbol </mtext><mo>≥</mo><mtext>, because the population </mtext><mi>P</mi><mtext> of Baker can equal</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>16,202 or it can be greater than 16,202</mtext><mtext>.</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>So, </mtext><mi>P</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>202.</mn>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
